claim: If class sizes at the Los Angeles school with the most SAT test takers scoring at least 1500 had been capped at 15 students, the average SAT writing score there would have exceeded 500.
reasoning: This is a counterfactual claim. It uses 'If... had been capped... would have exceeded' language, describing a hypothetical scenario about what would happen if class sizes were changed. The database only records what actually happened, not what would have occurred under different conditions. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from a database.

content.text:
This claim contains counterfactual language: "If class sizes... had been capped at 15 students, the average SAT writing score there would have exceeded 500." This describes a hypothetical scenario about what would have happened under different conditions.

The database records what actually happened, not what would have happened if class sizes were changed. A counterfactual claim like this cannot be verified from historical data.
